a drug is any substance taken into the
body that modifies or affects chemical
reactions in the body
certain drugs are used for medicinal
purposes to treat diseases
antibiotics are an example of drugs used
for the treatment of bacterial
infections
so antibiotic drugs are used to treat
bacterial infections
antibiotics work by
killing bacteria by destroying cell
walls leading to the bacterial cells
bursting
ah inhibiting their growth and
reproduction that is by preventing them
from multiplying and spreading
antibiotics only affect bacterial cells
without harming other living cells
antibiotics kill bacteria but do not
affect viruses
antibiotics are designed to Target
specific features of bacteria
viruses are unaffected by antibiotics as
they do not have bacterial features
some bacteria are resistant to
antibiotics which reduces the
effectiveness of the antibiotics
so when people take these antibiotic
medications it's becoming less and less
effective
commonly prescribed antibiotics are
becoming less effective due to overuse
that is when antibiotics are taken
unnecessarily
and incomplete courses when patients do
not complete the entire prescribed
duration of antibiotics
if antibiotics are overused then it will
allow these resistant bacteria to
survive and reproduce leading to the
rise of an entire strain with antibiotic
resistance
a common example of a drug resistant
bacteria or superbug is MRSA
so how do we limit the development of
resistant bacteria such as MRSA
by using antibiotics only when needed
therefore in order to try and slow down
the development of antibiotic resistant
bacteria antibiotics should be used only
when truly necessary and
the course of antibiotics given to the
patient should always be fully completed
before it is stopped to ensure that all
the bacteria is killed as stopping
treatment prematurely may allow
surviving bacteria to develop resistance
